results.title: After Deadly Blaze, Surge of Defiance Against China’s Covid Policies
results.abstract: Protests became rare once the government cut off most routes to collective action. But ubiquitous Covid rules, bringing shared suffering, have created a focus for anger.
results.byline: By Chris Buckley, Vivian Wang, Chang Che and Amy Chang Chien
des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

results.title: Memes, Puns and Blank Sheets of Paper: China’s Creative Acts of Protest
results.abstract: In a country where the authorities have little tolerance for open dissent, demonstrators against Covid restrictions have turned to more subtle methods.
results.byline: By Chang Che and Amy Chang Chien

multimedia.caption: A paper placed on a wall during a protest in Shanghai on Sunday read “I didn’t say anything.”
A paper placed on a wall during a protest in Shanghai on Sunday read “I didn’t say anything.”

results.title: Ukraine Warns of More Strikes on Power Plants, as Russians Dig In
results.abstract: Russian forces are fortifying positions in southern Ukraine after retreating from Kherson, and the Kremlin denied planning to withdraw from the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant.
results.byline: By Matthew Mpoke Bigg, Marc Santora and Maria Varenikova

multimedia.caption: Older residents are evacuated from Kherson on Sunday.
Older residents are evacuated from Kherson on Sunday.

results.title: A Sikh Temple Combats Loneliness With Chai and Laughter
results.abstract: A village in northern India has found a way to address a growing global issue: a deep sense of isolation among older people.

multimedia.caption: Karnail Singh Kakkar, in orange, with his friends at a village temple in Kakkar, northern India. The village began its experiment in dealing with the loneliness of older residents almost a decade ago.
multimedia.copyright: Atul Loke for The New York Times

results.title: For Putin’s Opponents, Exile From Russia Proves a Boon
results.abstract: The political network of Aleksei A. Navalny, the imprisoned opposition leader, had seemingly been crushed. But working from abroad, the Navalny team is using YouTube to spearhead antiwar efforts.

multimedia.caption: Irina Alleman, left, interviewing a Russian journalist, Tikhon Dzyadko, in Vilnius, Lithuania, on Popular Politics, a new YouTube channel run by the Russian opposition movement founded by Aleksei Navalny.
multimedia.copyright: Andrej Vasilenko for The New York Times

results.title: A Protest? A Vigil? In Beijing, Anxious Crowds Are Unsure How Far to Go.
results.abstract: In a country where protests are swiftly quashed, many who gathered to voice their discontent — under the watchful eye of the police — were uncertain about how far to go.

results.title: A U.S.-Iran Soccer Showdown Intensifies With Protests as a Backdrop
results.abstract: The unrest that has gripped Iran for the past two months has heightened what would already have been a tense encounter at the World Cup in Qatar on Tuesday between the two geopolitical foes.

multimedia.caption: Iran’s players during the singing of the national anthem ahead of their match with Wales at the World Cup in Al Rayyan, Qatar, on Friday.
Iran’s players during the singing of the national anthem ahead of their match with Wales at the World Cup in Al Rayyan, Qatar, on Friday.

results.title: Nine Civilians Killed in Militant Siege at a Mogadishu Hotel
results.abstract: An extremist group, Al Shabab, claimed responsibility for the 22-hour gun-and-bomb assault in the Somali capital, which ended with the death of all six attackers.
results.byline: By Hussein Mohamed and Declan Walsh

multimedia.caption: Central Mogadishu this month. As the Somali government has stepped up military operations against Al Shabab, the militants have escalated their bombing campaign in the capital.

results.title: China Protests Break Out as Covid Cases Surge and Lockdowns Persist
results.abstract: After a weekend of confrontations between officials and demonstrators, video from two sites in Shanghai and Beijing showed a heavy security presence. Here’s the latest on the situation.

results.title: Amid Scandals and Politics, Poland’s Youths Lose Faith in Catholic Church
results.abstract: The Polish church is in a deep crisis, as its authority is sapped by cascading sexual abuse scandals and as more people grow wary of its perceived alliance with the country’s right-wing government.

results.title: Russia postpones a meeting on a nuclear arms control treaty, U.S. officials say.
results.abstract: The treaty,  New START, calls for reciprocal inspections, but they have not been occurring, first because of the coronavirus pandemic, and now amid tensions over U.S. sanctions on Russia.
